name.fi: Online Academic Writing Skills for MSc students (w), Luento-opetus (Zoom, MSc students from CHEM, ELEC, ENG, SCI, BIZ))
name.sv: Online Academic Writing Skills for MSc students (w), Föreläsning (Zoom, MSc students from CHEM, ELEC, ENG, SCI, BIZ))
name.en: Online Academic Writing Skills for MSc students (w), Lecture (Zoom, MSc students from CHEM, ELEC, ENG, SCI, BIZ))

workload.fi: 54 h (independent online study as well as whole group and/or small group meetings)
workload.sv: 54 h (independent online study as well as whole group and/or small group meetings)
workload.en: 54 h (independent online study as well as whole group and/or small group meetings)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in written English academic communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in written documents related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication and vary the style according to the target audience text type
- Apply a process approach to the development of written work
- Document sources properly and select strategies to avoid plagiarism

- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication and vary the style according to the target audience text type
- Apply a process approach to the development of written work
- Document sources properly and select strategies to avoid plagiarism

- Apply a process approach to the development of written work
- Document sources properly and select strategies to avoid plagiarism

content.fi:
The course is intended for students in master's programs who are not yet in the process of writing their master's theses in English. It introduces written communication principles and strategies that are applicable to academic and research purposes. Students write on a topic from their own field of study based on previous (BSc) studies or current projects/courses in their Masters' studies. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, as well as other writing principles.
Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs, and in small groups to develop their writing skills. Furthermore, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly. Depending on the course variation (blended or fully online), the feedback and group work may be completed either face-to-face or online.

name.fi: Independent Projects in Intercultural Communication, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Independent Projects in Intercultural Communication, Föreläsning
name.en: Independent Projects in Intercultural Communication, Lecture

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: LC-0610 Intercultural Communication LC-0614 Developing Global Competence: Working in an International Virtual Team LC-0615 Intercultural Communication in Teamwork
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: LC-0610 Intercultural Communication LC-0614 Developing Global Competence: Working in an International Virtual Team LC-0615 Intercultural Communication in Teamwork
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: LC-0610 Intercultural Communication LC-0614 Developing Global Competence: Working in an International Virtual Team LC-0615 Intercultural Communication in Teamwork

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate:
  • an ability to independently develop a description and analysis of an intercultural case related to professional/academic/social contexts
  • an ability to independently explore and draw on concepts from the field of Intercultural Communication
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate:
  • an ability to independently develop a description and analysis of an intercultural case related to professional/academic/social contexts
  • an ability to independently explore and draw on concepts from the field of Intercultural Communication
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate:
  • an ability to independently develop a description and analysis of an intercultural case related to professional/academic/social contexts
  • an ability to independently explore and draw on concepts from the field of Intercultural Communication

content.fi:
With the online guidance of the teacher, students choose and conduct an independent research project, consisting of one of the following options:
  • an analysis of the interactional dynamics in a specific professional/academic setting abroad
  • an analysis of the interactional dynamics in a multicultural project in a professional or academic context
  • an analysis of the interactional dynamics in the integration of foreign employees or students in society while living abroad

workload.fi: 36 h (kontaktiopetus) + 72 h (itsenäinen työskentely)
workload.sv: 36 h (kontaktundervisning) + 72 h (självständigt arbete)
workload.en: 36 h (contact hours) + 72 h (self-study)

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Kiina 4 tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Kinesiska 4 eller motsvarande kunskaper
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Chinese 4 or equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
Suoritettuasi kurssin
- osaat kommunikoida käyttäen monipuolista sanastoa ja tärkeimpiä kieliopillisia rakenteita
- ymmärrät arkisia yksinkertaisia tekstejä
- osaat kirjoittaa entistä pidempiä tekstejä ja viestiä sähköpostitse
- hallitset kieliopin ja kieliopillisten rakenteiden perusteet
- tunnistat noin 200 uutta kirjoitusmerkkiä.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs
- kan du kommunicera med hjälp av en mångsidig vokabulär och de viktigaste grammatiska strukturerna
- förstår du vardagliga enkla texter
- kan du skriva längre texter än tidigare och kommunicera per e-post
- behärskar du grunderna i grammatiken och de grammatiska strukturerna
- känner du till ungefär 200 nya skrivtecken.
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completing the course, you will be able to do the following things in Chinese:
- Communicate with people using a variety of vocabulary and key grammatical structures- Understand simple everyday texts - Be able to write longer texts and exchange emails- Know the fundamental elements of grammar and grammatical structures- Understand about 200 new characters

content.fi: Kartutamme kiinan sanavarastoa, kertaamme kielioppia ja opimme uutta. Paljon keskustelu- ja kuullunymmärtämisharjoituksia ja kirjoitustehtäviä sekä tutustumista entistä syvemmin kiinalaiseen kulttuuriin.
content.sv: Vi utökar vårt ordförråd, repeterar grammatik och lär oss nytt. Många diskussionsövningar, hörförståelser och skrivuppgifter samt ännu djupare bekantskap med den kinesiska kulturen.
content.en: Expanding Chinese vocabulary, revising and increasing grammar, plenty of oral exercises, listening comprehension exercises and writing assignments, deepening knowledge of Chinese culture.

assesmentMethods.fi:
1. Luennot 36 t, itsenäinen opiskelu 72 t, aktiivinen osallistuminen. Pakollinen läsnäolo 75 %.
  2. Ryhmätyöt ja suulliset ja kirjalliset tehtävät (40 %).
  3. Suullinen tentti (20%).
  4. Kirjallinen tentti (40%).
assesmentMethods.sv:
1. Föreläsningar 36 h, självständigt arbete 45 h, aktivt deltagande. Obligatorisk närvaro 75 %
  2. Grupparbeten samt skriftliga och muntliga uppgifter (40 %)
  3. Muntlig tentamen (20 %)
  4. Skriftlig tentamen (40 %)
assesmentMethods.en:
1. Lectures 36 h and self-study 45 h, active participation. Passing the course requires 75% attendance in class.
  2. Group work, oral and written assignments (40%)
  3. Oral exam (20%)
  4. Written exam (40%)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
- Present, challenge and defend solutions to real-life sustainability issues faced by companies and organizations
- Organize arguments clearly, cohesively and concisely in speaking and in writing
- Collaborate in interdisciplinary teams
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
- Present, challenge and defend solutions to real-life sustainability issues faced by companies and organizations
- Organize arguments clearly, cohesively and concisely in speaking and in writing
- Collaborate in interdisciplinary teams
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:
- Present, challenge and defend solutions to real-life sustainability issues faced by companies and organizations
- Organize arguments clearly, cohesively and concisely in speaking and in writing
- Collaborate in interdisciplinary teams

content.fi:
This three-credit interdisciplinary problem-based learning (PBL) course focuses on developing key spoken and written communication skills required for future working life.
During the course, students learn the necessary tools to collaborate in interdisciplinary teams to find solutions to real-life sustainability issues faced by companies and organizations. Each student functions as an expert on their particular area within the team and is responsible for researching the solution from that particular angle, for example, design, branding, technical or financial viability. Students practise structuring arguments and counterarguments both in speaking and in writing as well as apply different types of reasoning behind argumentation. Students analyse speeches and sample texts to identify strengths and weaknesses. During the course, students receive constructive feedback on their written and spoken argumentation skills, give feedback to others, and reflect on their own performance.

prerequisites.fi: The course is intended for doctoral students who have started writing their research articles and/or thesis. Therefore, participants must bring samples of their ongoing writing as this will be a part of the material used in the course.

learningOutcomes.fi: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to - Recognise the features of effective academic writing for their own fields - Recognise ineffective sentences and utilise techniques for re-writing them - Analyse sample texts to identify the language conventions and style particular to their own fields of study
learningOutcomes.sv: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to - Recognise the features of effective academic writing for their own fields - Recognise ineffective sentences and utilise techniques for re-writing them - Analyse sample texts to identify the language conventions and style particular to their own fields of study
learningOutcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to - Recognise the features of effective academic writing for their own fields - Recognise ineffective sentences and utilise techniques for re-writing them - Analyse sample texts to identify the language conventions and style particular to their own fields of study

content.fi: As part of this course, students must bring samples of their scientific writing-in-progress as this material forms a core part of the course. During the course, students work to improve their writing as they apply skills and techniques introduced in the course. The course content will include aspects of writing, such as - Internal organisation of a text, including sequencing of information, paragraph writing and sentence structures - Appropriateness to the reader (i.e. the target audience), including text structure, sentence and paragraph length, and vocabulary choice - Clarity of the message (information organisation, referencing, and cohesiveness) - Writing effective sentences, paragraphs and sections (such as abstracts, introductions, and conclusions) - Argumentation and researcher positioning/stance - Editing for accuracy The coursework will enable participants to write more effectively and with greater confidence for an international readership. In response to student needs, the course design includes individual and pair exercises, analysis, and critiques, all of which focus on training participants with specific tools for producing improved text. Simultaneously, students will be guided in recognising stylistic and organisational features common to formal written English, and applying features appropriate in their specific fields. As part of feedback, students submit their written text(s) for teacher and peer review. Working Life Skills: Skills in a foreign language, Written communication, Information retrieval, Ethical consciousness, Critical thinking, Lifelong learning, Self-confidence, Analytical skills, Time-management, Self-awareness, and Knowledge of research in own field.

learningOutcomes.sv: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to - Recognise the features of effective academic writing for their own fields - Recognise ineffective sentences and utilise techniques for re-writing them - Analyse sample texts to identify the language conventions and style particular to their own fields of study
learningOutcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to - Recognise the features of effective academic writing for their own fields - Recognise ineffective sentences and utilise techniques for re-writing them - Analyse sample texts to identify the language conventions and style particular to their own fields of study

content.fi: As part of this course, students must bring samples of their scientific writing-in-progress as this material forms a core part of the course. During the course, students work to improve their writing as they apply skills and techniques introduced in the course. The course content will include aspects of writing, such as - Internal organisation of a text, including sequencing of information, paragraph writing and sentence structures - Appropriateness to the reader (i.e. the target audience), including text structure, sentence and paragraph length, and vocabulary choice - Clarity of the message (information organisation, referencing, and cohesiveness) - Writing effective sentences, paragraphs and sections (such as abstracts, introductions, and conclusions) - Argumentation and researcher positioning/stance - Editing for accuracy The coursework will enable participants to write more effectively and with greater confidence for an international readership. In response to student needs, the course design includes individual and pair exercises, analysis, and critiques, all of which focus on training participants with specific tools for producing improved text. Simultaneously, students will be guided in recognising stylistic and organisational features common to formal written English, and applying features appropriate in their specific fields. As part of feedback, students submit their written text(s) for teacher and peer review. Working Life Skills: Skills in a foreign language, Written communication, Information retrieval, Ethical consciousness, Critical thinking, Lifelong learning, Self-confidence, Analytical skills, Time-management, Self-awareness, and Knowledge of research in own field.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to: - write more competently in formal and informal genres
- express your opinions and ideas in written and spoken communication
- reflect on and implement the writing process from drafting to revision and final work
- apply principles of academic writing to produce sentences and paragraphs that are cohesive and easy to read

content.fi: In this course, students choose between a number of modules to create an individualised path for developing their writing and spoken skills for art, design, and architecture. Students work on a particular project or idea of their choosing which forms the basis of all the tasks in the course. This course goes through the stages of generating and developing ideas, exploring points of views, researching, revising, structuring, and co-editing text. The course may include elements of both creative and academic or professional writing, such as applications, analyses, and artist/designer statements. The initial spoken exercises develop the student s knowledge and opinions on the project or idea. The course continues by introducing formal text structure as well as cohesion and coherence. Throughout the course, students collaborate with their peers through brainstorming, sharing ideas, developing argumentation, critiquing each other s writing, and giving feedback. Working Life Skills: Know-how related to my own field of studies, Job seeking skills, Foreign language skills, Skills related to working in international environment, Information retrieval skills, Written communication skills, Team work skills, Self-Awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical skills, Lifelong learning skills, Career planning skills, Job seeking skills, Self-confidence, Creativity and Time management. Note: May vary depending on chosen modules.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, students will be able to: - effectively demonstrate their field-specific professional and/or academic expertise in spoken and written communication
- develop and deliver an effective spoken presentation on a field-specific project or research area
- structure their ideas and language coherently and cohesively for a particular audience
- receive and give constructive feedback

content.fi: In this course, students focus on developing their spoken and written English communication skills to better express their expertise to a particular audience. Students develop and deliver a spoken presentation on an existing personal project or research area within their field of expertise. As well, they are able to choose between a number of modules to create an individualised path for developing their written skills with a focus on their demonstrating their expertise. Depending on the modules chosen, the course may include elements of both creative and academic or professional writing, such as applications, analyses, and artist/designer statements. workload.fi:
- kontaktiopetus 24-36 h
- opiskelijan itsenäinen työskentely ja kirjallinen tentti valmistautumisineen 45-57 h
workload.sv:
- kontaktundervisning 24-36 t
- självständigt arbete och skriftlig tentamen inklusive förberedelser 45-57 t
workload.en:
- contact hours 24-36 h
- independent work by the student and a written examination, and preparing for the exam: 45-57 h

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuasi: - osaat kommunikoida tuttujen vakioilmaisujen avulla arki- ja työelämän helpoissa
tilanteissa. Pystyt mm. esittelemään itsesi ja vastaamaan yksinkertaisiin kysymyksiin ranskaksi. - osaat laatia lyhyitä kirjallisia viestejä tuttujen sanontojen ja lauserakenteiden avulla. - ymmärrät helpohkon tekstin keskeisen sisällön apuvälineitä käyttäen. - tunnistat ja ymmärrät jonkin verran ranskankielisten maiden tapakulttuurien erityispiirteitä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter slutförd kurs har du följande kunskaper: - Du kan kommunicera i enkla situationer i vardags- och arbetslivet med hjälp av bekanta standardfraser. Du kan bland annat presentera dig själv och besvara enkla frågor på franska. - Du kan skriva korta meddelanden med hjälp av bekanta talesätt och satsstrukturer. - Du förstår det centrala innehållet i relativt lätta texter med hjälp av hjälpmedel. - Du kan i någon mån identifiera och förstå särdragen i de seder och bruk som råder i fransktalande länder.
learningOutcomes.en:
At course completion, you will be able:
- to communicate using familiar phrases in simple situations in and outside of work.
- to, e.g. introduce yourself and answer simple questions in French.
- to write short messages using familiar phraseology and grammatical constructions.
- to understand the gist of relatively easy texts with the help of language tools.
- to recognise and understand some of the cultural features and customs typical of the French-speaking world.

content.fi: Kielen perusrakenteiden sekä arki- ja työelämän suppean perussanaston omaksuminen, arki- ja työelämän yksinkertaisten asioimistilanteiden harjoittelu ja tapakulttuuriin tutustuminen.
content.sv: Tillägnande av språkets grundläggande strukturer samt basvokabulär för vardags- och arbetslivet, övningar i enkla ärenden i vardags- och arbetslivet samt introduktion till seder och bruk.
content.en: Understanding the basic structures and vocabulary needed in everyday life and work and practising related simple communicative situations, and getting to know some customs of the French-speaking world.

assesmentMethods.fi:
1. Luennot 36 t, aktiivinen osallistuminen opetukseen. Pakollinen läsnäolo 80 %. Osallistuminen vahvistettava ensimmäisellä luennolla. 
2. Kirjalliset tehtävät itsenäisesti ja tunneilla ja/tai testit ( 
50%) 
3. Suullinen koe ja/tai suulliset tehtävät  (50 %)
assesmentMethods.sv:
1. Föreläsningar 24-36 h, aktivt deltagande i undervisningen både under föreläsningarna och självständigt (30 %). Obligatorisk närvaro 80 %. Du ska bekräfta att du deltar i kursen på den första föreläsningen.
2. Skriftliga uppgifter och videopresentation (20 %).
3. Skriftlig tentamen (50 %).
assesmentMethods.en:
1. Lectures 24-36 h, active participation in teaching both in class and independently (30%). 80% attendance in class is required. Registration must be confirmed by attending the first lecture.
2. Written assignments and video presentation (20%)
3. Written examination: 50%

Du kan bland annat presentera dig själv och besvara enkla frågor på franska. - Du kan skriva korta meddelanden med hjälp av bekanta talesätt och satsstrukturer. - Du förstår det centrala innehållet i relativt lätta texter med hjälp av hjälpmedel. - Du kan i någon mån identifiera och förstå särdragen i de seder och bruk som råder i fransktalande länder.
learningOutcomes.en:
At course completion, you will be able:
- to communicate using familiar phrases in simple situations in and outside of work.
- to, e.g. introduce yourself and answer simple questions in French.
- to write short messages using familiar phraseology and grammatical constructions.
- to understand the gist of relatively easy texts with the help of language tools.
- to recognise and understand some of the cultural features and customs typical of the French-speaking world.

content.fi: Kielen perusrakenteiden sekä arki- ja työelämän suppean perussanaston omaksuminen, arki- ja työelämän yksinkertaisten asioimistilanteiden harjoittelu ja tapakulttuuriin tutustuminen.
content.sv: Tillägnande av språkets grundläggande strukturer samt basvokabulär för vardags- och arbetslivet, övningar i enkla ärenden i vardags- och arbetslivet samt introduktion till seder och bruk.
content.en: Understanding the basic structures and vocabulary needed in everyday life and work and practising related simple communicative situations, and getting to know some customs of the French-speaking world.

content.fi:
This course introduces written and oral communication principles and strategies that are applicable to professional and academic purposes and is at the same time integrated with a content course or a specific program. Written tasks and oral tasks will support the content course or the program and be largely determined by its requirements. Throughout this course, students work individually and/or in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. Moreover, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills: Varies according to each integration project.

- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

learningOutcomes.fi:
The main goal of this course is that students will find their own way to learn, study and use English both in meaningful personal contexts as well as in academic / working life situations. Students will develop their English skills towards autonomous and spontaneous language use. Furthermore, the goal is that students manage their own learning process by doing the following: · Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs
· Setting personalised learning goals
· Choosing their approach to learning
· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out
· Reflecting on their learning process and results
learningOutcomes.sv:
The main goal of this course is that students will find their own way to learn, study and use English both in meaningful personal contexts as well as in academic / working life situations. Students will develop their English skills towards autonomous and spontaneous language use. Furthermore, the goal is that students manage their own learning process by doing the following:
· Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs· Setting personalised learning goals· Choosing their approach to learning· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out· Reflecting on their learning process and results
learningOutcomes.en:
The main goal of this course is that students will find their own way to learn, study and use English both in meaningful personal contexts as well as in academic / working life situations. Students will develop their English skills towards autonomous and spontaneous language use. Furthermore, the goal is that students manage their own learning process by doing the following:
· Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs· Setting personalised learning goals· Choosing their approach to learning· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out· Reflecting on their learning process and results

content.fi:
The students will devise a personalised learning plan together with the teacher, in which they consider their own special needs and ways to learn a foreign language. The small group meetings and individual consultations with the teacher will deal with several topics, such as
· Language learner history and its effects on one s English learner identity· Ways of reflecting on one s own learning, such as a learning diary· Realistic methods for self-evaluation· Using and developing English together with other students· Skills for learning and studying English, depending on the particular needs of the students: listening, reading, speaking, writing.
Working Life Skills:
Skills in a foreign language, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Lifelong learning skills, Self-confidence, Time management, and Team work skill.

One group is open for students with a learning difficulty, such as dyslexia, ADHD, language phobia, panic disorder or other similar reasons explained upon registration in WebOodi. The second group is open for all students. In these groups, students are considered for admission in order of highest number of credits.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The main goal of this course is that students will find their own way to learn, study and use English both in meaningful personal contexts as well as in academic / working life situations. Students will develop their English skills towards autonomous and spontaneous language use. Furthermore, the goal is that students manage their own learning process by doing the following: · Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs
· Setting personalised learning goals
· Choosing their approach to learning
· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out
· Reflecting on their learning process and results

· Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs· Setting personalised learning goals· Choosing their approach to learning· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out· Reflecting on their learning process and results

Students will develop their English skills towards autonomous and spontaneous language use. Furthermore, the goal is that students manage their own learning process by doing the following:
· Analysing their own identity as an English learner and their learning needs· Setting personalised learning goals· Choosing their approach to learning· Making a concrete learning plan and carrying it out· Reflecting on their learning process and results

content.fi:
The students will devise a personalised learning plan together with the teacher, in which they consider their own special needs and ways to learn a foreign language. The small group meetings and individual consultations with the teacher will deal with several topics, such as
· Language learner history and its effects on one s English learner identity· Ways of reflecting on one s own learning, such as a learning diary· Realistic methods for self-evaluation· Using and developing English together with other students· Skills for learning and studying English, depending on the particular needs of the students: listening, reading, speaking, writing.
Working Life Skills:
Skills in a foreign language, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Lifelong learning skills, Self-confidence, Time management, and Team work skill.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

content.fi:
This course introduces written and oral communication principles and strategies that are applicable to professional and academic purposes. Students begin by writing on a topic from their own field of study. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, and employ other writing principles that make comprehension of sentences and paragraphs easier. Based on their written work, students deliver an oral presentation which is videoed for self- and teacher-evaluation. As part of the learning process, students analyse presentations to identify their strengths and areas for improvement, and practise organising and presenting information clearly to a non-expert audience. Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs and in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. In addition, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills:
Knowledge of research in own field, Skills in foreign languages, Information retrieval skills, Ethical consciousness, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical, Lifelong learning skills, and Self-confidence

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

content.fi:
This course introduces written and oral communication principles and strategies that are applicable to professional and academic purposes. Students begin by writing on a topic from their own field of study. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, and employ other writing principles that make comprehension of sentences and paragraphs easier. Based on their written work, students deliver an oral presentation which is videoed for self- and teacher-evaluation. As part of the learning process, students analyse presentations to identify their strengths and areas for improvement, and practise organising and presenting information clearly to a non-expert audience. Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs and in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. In addition, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills:
Knowledge of research in own field, Skills in foreign languages, Information retrieval skills, Ethical consciousness, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical, Lifelong learning skills, and Self-confidence

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

content.fi:
This course introduces written and oral communication principles and strategies that are applicable to professional and academic purposes. Students begin by writing on a topic from their own field of study. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, and employ other writing principles that make comprehension of sentences and paragraphs easier. Based on their written work, students deliver an oral presentation which is videoed for self- and teacher-evaluation. As part of the learning process, students analyse presentations to identify their strengths and areas for improvement, and practise organising and presenting information clearly to a non-expert audience. Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs and in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. In addition, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills:
Knowledge of research in own field, Skills in foreign languages, Information retrieval skills, Ethical consciousness, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical, Lifelong learning skills, and Self-confidence

Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

content.fi:
This course introduces written and oral communication principles and strategies that are applicable to professional and academic purposes. Students begin by writing on a topic from their own field of study. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, and employ other writing principles that make comprehension of sentences and paragraphs easier. Based on their written work, students deliver an oral presentation which is videoed for self- and teacher-evaluation. As part of the learning process, students analyse presentations to identify their strengths and areas for improvement, and practise organising and presenting information clearly to a non-expert audience. Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs and in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. In addition, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills:
Knowledge of research in own field, Skills in foreign languages, Information retrieval skills, Ethical consciousness, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical, Lifelong learning skills, and Self-confidence

Students begin by writing on a topic from their own field of study. To enhance readability of the texts, students apply organisational patterns, such as problem-solution, and employ other writing principles that make comprehension of sentences and paragraphs easier. Based on their written work, students deliver an oral presentation which is videoed for self- and teacher-evaluation. As part of the learning process, students analyse presentations to identify their strengths and areas for improvement, and practise organising and presenting information clearly to a non-expert audience. Throughout this course, students work individually, in pairs and in small groups to develop their presentation and writing skills. In addition, students give and receive constructive feedback on their work and revise it accordingly.
Working Life Skills:
Knowledge of research in own field, Skills in foreign languages, Information retrieval skills, Ethical consciousness, Written & Oral communication, Self-awareness, Critical thinking skills, Analytical, Lifelong learning skills, and Self-confidence

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, the students will be able to
- Recognise the strategies and elements that enhance clarity and audience-friendliness in both oral and written communication
- Apply these strategies and elements in oral presentations and writing related to their field of study
- Distinguish between formal and informal styles of communication

name.fi: A Digital Presence in English (o,w), Luento-opetus
name.sv: A Digital Presence in English (o,w), Föreläsning
name.en: A Digital Presence in English (o,w), Lecture

workload.fi: 81 h online work
workload.sv: 81 h online work
workload.en: 81 h online work

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: CEFR B2. The course is primarily targeted at ARTS bachelor students, but students from other schools may particpate if there is space
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: CEFR B2. The course is primarily targeted at ARTS bachelor students, but students from other schools may particpate if there is space
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CEFR B2. The course is primarily targeted at ARTS bachelor students, but students from other schools may particpate if there is space

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of the course, the students will be able to:
  • Effectively present projects related to their fields on video
  • Target their presentations to the audience s background, needs, and interests
  • Apply effectively skills that help to engage the listener/reader
  • Analyze their strengths and develop awareness of their digital skills
  • Effectively write about concepts related to the field of study (art, design, or architecture)
learningOutcomes.sv:
Upon completion of the course, the students will be able to:
  • Effectively present projects related to their fields on video
  • Target their presentations to the audience s background, needs, and interests
  • Apply effectively skills that help to engage the listener/reader
  • Analyze their strengths and develop awareness of their digital skills
  • Effectively write about concepts related to the field of study (art, design, or architecture)
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of the course, the students will be able to:
  • Effectively present projects related to their fields on video
  • Target their presentations to the audience s background, needs, and interests
  • Apply effectively skills that help to engage the listener/reader
  • Analyze their strengths and develop awareness of their digital skills
  • Effectively write about concepts related to the field of study (art, design, or architecture)

content.fi:
During the course, students first self-assess their digital skills.
Then, they enhance their competence and confidence in English while establishing a digital presence through the use of a blog.
The blog will include different multimedia elements that allow students to present oral and written work related to their field of study.
Not only will students post blogs but also comment on peer blogs.
The course is suitable for students who are ready to present a current or previous project (in art, design, or architecture).

workload.fi: 2 opintopisteen suorittajilla kontaktiopetus 24 h, itsenäinen työskentely 30 h 3 opintopisteen suorittajilla kontaktiopetus 24 h, itsenäinen työskentely 57 h Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää vähintään 80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa.
workload.sv: Kontaktundervisning 24 h för 2 studiepoäng, självständigt arbete 30 h Kontaktundervisning 24 h för 3 studiepoäng, självständigt arbete 57 h Godkänd kurs förutsätter 80 % närvaro i kontaktundervisningen.
workload.en: For 2 credits: contact hours 24 h, independent study 30 h For 3 credits: contact hours 24 h, independent study 57 h Passing the course requires 80% attendance in class.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija: - osaa havainnoida ja analysoida vuorovaikutusta erilaisissa vuorovaikutustilanteissa 
- osaa antaa ja vastaanottaa palautetta viestintä- ja vuorovaikutustaidoista  - tunnistaa omia vahvuuksiaan ja kehittämiskohteitaan viestijänä ja osaa asettaa tavoitteita vuorovaikutusosaamisensa kehittämiseksi  - on kehittänyt valmiuksiaan toimia tarkoituksenmukaisesti ja eettisesti erilaisissa vuorovaikutustilanteissa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs:
- kan du observera och analysera interaktion i olika situationer - kan du ge och ta emot respons på kommunikations- och interaktionsfärdigheter - har du utvecklat din kommunikationsförmåga och känner till dina styrkor och vad du behöver utveckla
learningOutcomes.en:
After taking the course, students will:
- be able to make observations and analyse interactions in a variety of situations - be able to give and receive feedback on their communication and interaction skills - have increased their communication skills and be aware of their strengths and areas for improvement

content.fi:
Kurssilla tutustutaan viestinnän ja vuorovaikutuksen eri osa-alueisiin ja harjoitellaan vuorovaikutustaitoja erilaisissa tilanteissa. Keskeisiä teemoja ovat esimerkiksi: 
  • Kuunteleminen ja palautevuorovaikutus 
  • Keskustelu-, yhteistyö-, argumentointi-, esiintymis- ja yleisötaidot 
  • Ryhmäviestintä 
  • Vuorovaikutuksen eettisyys; moninaisuuden ja yhdenvertaisuuden huomioiminen vuorovaikutuksessa 
Kurssi sopii hyvin ensimmäiseksi viestinnän ja vuorovaikutuksen kurssiksi.
content.sv: I kursen behandlas olika delområden av kommunikation och färdigheter i framträdande och interaktion övas. Det centrala är utvecklandet av den studerandes egen komunikationsförmåga. Centrala teman är kommunikation och växelverkan, diskussionsförmåga, att lyssna, respons, gruppkommunikation, att framträda och rampfeber. Kursen lämpar sig väl som första kurs i (tal)kommunikation.
content.en: The course introduces students to different aspects of communication and trains their public speaking and interactive skills. The focus is on developing communication skills. Key themes include communication and interaction, discussion, listening, feedback, group communication, public speaking and stage fright. The course is well-suited to be taken as the first (speech) communication course.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin hyväksytty suorittaminen edellyttää 80% läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa, aktiivista ja rakentavaa osallistumista luentoihin, ryhmätöihin ja harjoituksiin sekä kurssin oppimistehtävien hyväksyttyä suorittamista. Kurssin työskentelymuotoja ovat keskusteleva luennointi, pari- ja ryhmätyöskentely, harjoitukset, palautekeskustelut ja itsenäiset oppimistehtävät.  Kurssin voi suorittaa 2 tai 3 op laajuisena. Kolmen opintopisteen suorittajat tekevät edellä kuvatun lisäksi 1 op laajuisen itsenäinen oppimistehtävän (essee tai muu oppimistehtävä).
assesmentMethods.sv: För att få godkänt i kursen förutsätts 80 % närvaro under kontaktundervisningen, aktivt och konstruktivt deltagande i föreläsningarna, grupparbetena och övningarna samt godkänt i kursuppgifterna. Kursens arbetssätt är diskussionsinriktade föreläsningar, par- och grupparbete, övningar, responsdiskussioner och självständiga kursuppgifter. Kursens omfattning kan vara 2 eller 3 sp. De som genomför kursen som en 3 sp-kurs gör utöver vad som beskrivs tidigare en självständig kursuppgift värd 1 sp (essä eller annan kursuppgift).
assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires an 80% attendance rate in contact teaching, active and constructive participation in class, group work and exercises, as well as passing all the assignments given on the course. The course working methods include interactive lectures, pair and group work, exercises, feedback sessions and independent learning assignments. The course may be completed as a 2-credit or 3-credit course. Those who do a 3-credit version of the course, do an independent learning assignment (essay or other assignment) in addition to the abovementioned tasks.

Korvaa kurssin LC-0310 Puheviestinnän perusteet.
Korvaa kurssin Vie-98.1400 Työelämän viestintätaidot.
substitutes.sv:
Ersätter kursen LC-0310 Introduktion i talkommunikation.
Ersätter kursen Vie-98.1400 Kommunikativa färdigheter för arbetslivet .
substitutes.en: LC-0310 Communication Skills L Vie-98.1400 Workplace Communication Skills

name.en: Conference presentations D_This group is in English, Lecture

workload.fi: 1 opintopisteen suorittajilla kontaktiopetus 12 h, itsenäinen työskentely 15 h 2 opintopisteen suorittajilla kontaktiopetus 12 h, itsenäinen työskentely 42 h  Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää vähintään 80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa.
workload.sv: Kontaktundervisning 12 h för 1 studiepoäng, självständigt arbete 15 h  Kontaktundervisning 12 h för 2 studiepoäng, självständigt arbete 42 h Godkänd kurs förutsätter 80 % närvaro i kontaktundervisningen.
workload.en: For 1 credits: contact hours 12 h, independent study 15 h For 2 credits: contact hours 12 h, independent study 42 h Passing the course requires 80% attendance in class.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija: - osaa valmistella selkeän ja havainnollisen konferenssiesityksen  
- tunnistaa omia vahvuuksiaan ja kehityskohteitaan esiintyjänä ja osaa asettaa tavoitteita kehittymiselleen  - osaa analysoida toisten esityksiä, eritellä niissä käytettyjä viestinnän keinoja ja antaa rakentavaa vertaispalautetta.  
- on harjaantunut yleisön kysymyksiin vastaamisessa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs kan du:
- förbereda en tydlig och överskådlig presentation - har du utvecklat dina presentationsfärdigheter - fått rutin i att svara på frågor från publiken
learningOutcomes.en:
After taking the course, students will:
- be able to give an organised and illustrative presentation- have developed their public speaking and presentation skills- have gained experience in answering questions posed by the audience.

content.fi: Kurssi on suunnattu ensisijaisesti tohtoriopiskelijoille. Kurssin keskeisenä sisältönä on tieteellisen konferenssiesityksen suunnittelu, jäsentäminen ja esittäminen sekä yleisön kysymyksiin vastaaminen. Kurssi on käytännönläheinen ja harjoituspainotteinen. Opiskelija pitää omasta tutkimuksestaan esityksen muulle ryhmälle ja saa palautetta esityksestään.  Esitykset videoidaan ja opiskelija kirjoittaa videon perusteella itsearvioinnin oman kehittymisensä tueksi.
content.sv: Kursen är i första hand riktad till doktorandstuderande. Kursens centrala innehåll är planering av ett vetenskapligt konferensframträdande, analys och framförande samt att svara på publikens frågor. Kursen är praktisk till sin natur och betoningen är lagd vid övningar. Den studerande håller ett föredrag om sin egen forskning för gruppen och får respons. Föredragen videofilmas och den studerande skriver baserat på videon en självbedöming för att stöda sin egen utveckling.
content.en: The course is primarily intended for doctoral students. The key contents of the course consist of designing conference presentations and giving a presentation, as well as answering questions by the audience. The course takes a practical approach and is exercise-intensive. Students give a presentation on their research topic to the rest of the group and receive feedback for it. The presentations are recorded on video, and each student writes a self-evaluation on the basis of the video in order to gain tools to further develop their skills.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin hyväksytty suorittaminen edellyttää 80% läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa, aktiivista ja rakentavaa osallistumista luentoihin, harjoituksiin ja palautekeskusteluihin sekä kurssin oppimistehtävien hyväksyttyä suorittamista. Kurssin työskentelymuotoja kontaktiopetuksessa ovat keskusteleva luennointi, esiintymisharjoitukset ja palautekeskustelut (12 tuntia). Itsenäisiä oppimistehtäviä ovat: valmistautuminen esityksen pitämiseen, oman esityksen videotallenteen analysointi ja itsearvioinnin kirjoittaminen (15 tuntia).  Kurssin voi suorittaa myös 2 op laajuisena. Kahden opintopisteen suorittajat tekevät edellä kuvatun lisäksi 1 op laajuisen itsenäinen oppimistehtävän (essee, videoesitys tai muu oppimistehtävä).
assesmentMethods.sv: För att få godkänt i kursen förutsätts 80 % närvaro under kontaktundervisningen, aktivt och konstruktivt deltagande i föreläsningarna, övningarna och responsdiskussionerna samt godkänt i kursuppgifterna. Kontaktundervsiningens arbetsformer är ett diskuterande föreläsningssätt, föredragsövningar och responsdiskussioner (12 h). Självständiga kursuppgifter är: förberedande arbete för att hålla föredrag, analys av eget inspelat föredrag och att skriva en självbedömning (15 h). Kursen kan även genomföras som en 2 sp-kurs. De som genomför kursen som en 2 sp-kurs gör utöver vad som beskrivs tidigare en självständig kursuppgift värd 1 sp (essä, videoföredrag eller annan kursuppgift).
assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires an 80% attendance rate in contact teaching, active participation and constructive attitude in class, exercises and feedback discussions, as well as passing all the assignments given on the course. The course working methods in class include interactive lectures, public speaking exercises and feedback discussions (12 h). Independent assignments consist of preparations for the presentation, analysing the video recording of one s presentation and writing a self-evaluation report (15 hours). The course may also be completed as a 2-credit course. Those who complete a 2-credit version of the course, do a 1-credit independent learning assignment (essay or other assignment) in addition to the abovementioned tasks.

name.en: Academic Writing (w), Lecture (for ARTS master's students writing their thesis)

workload.fi:
81 h (Small-group instruction 16 to 36 h + guided independent work 45 to 65 h)
Some iterations of the course might be held entirely online. Please check SISU for further information.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Students are expected to have 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of (draft) thesis text to submit at the start of the course (not the thesis proposal but part of a chapter of the thesis).
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Students are expected to have 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of (draft) thesis text to submit at the start of the course (not the thesis proposal but part of a chapter of the thesis).
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Students are expected to have 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of (draft) thesis text to submit at the start of the course (not the thesis proposal but part of a chapter of the thesis).

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to - Produce clear and structured language for an academic text in English
- Apply discourse conventions common to academic writing in English
- Revise aspects of their writing to improve readability
- Apply strategies for editing texts, based on feedback
learningOutcomes.sv:

- Produce clear and structured language for an academic text in English- Apply discourse conventions common to academic writing in English- Revise aspects of their writing to improve readability- Apply strategies for editing texts, based on feedback
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to
- Produce clear and structured language for an academic text in English- Apply discourse conventions common to academic writing in English- Revise aspects of their writing to improve readability- Apply strategies for editing texts, based on feedback

content.fi:
Successful participation requires that you have a research topic, have begun your research, and have already produced at least 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of thesis text by the beginning of the course.
This course covers academic writing as part of the investigative research-based reading and writing process for the scholarly field of art. It carries students through a writing process for creating a clear, well-structured text.
During the course, students work to improve their academic texts as they apply writing skills and techniques introduced in the course, such as structuring a text (for increasing readability), integrating citations and applying appropriate citing conventions, applying linguistic methods of argumentation, and reviewing sentence form and function as well as other writing mechanics (as needed).
The course also introduces tools and practices that help with writing in English. In addition, students collaborate on writing exercises where giving and receiving peer feedback is an essential component.
Working Life Skills:Knowledge of research in own field, skills in a foreign language, written communication, information retrieval skills, working independently, critical thinking skills, practical application of theories, team working skills, lifelong learning skills, self-confidence, analytical skills, time management, and self-awareness.
Prerequisites: Students are expected to have 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of (draft) thesis text to submit at the start of the course (not the thesis proposal but part of a chapter of the thesis).

content.sv:
Successful participation requires that you have a research topic, have begun your research, and have already produced at least 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of thesis text by the beginning of the course.
This course covers academic writing as part of the investigative research-based reading and writing process for the scholarly field of art. It carries students through a writing process for creating a clear, well-structured text.
During the course, students work to improve their academic texts as they apply writing skills and techniques introduced in the course, such as structuring a text (for increasing readability), integrating citations and applying appropriate citing conventions, applying linguistic methods of argumentation, and reviewing sentence form and function as well as other writing mechanics (as needed).
The course also introduces tools and practices that help with writing in English. In addition, students collaborate on writing exercises where giving and receiving peer feedback is an essential component.
Working Life Skills:Knowledge of research in own field, skills in a foreign language, written communication, information retrieval skills, working independently, critical thinking skills, practical application of theories, team working skills, lifelong learning skills, self-confidence, analytical skills, time management, and self-awareness.
Prerequisites: Students are expected to have 2 to 3 pages (1200 to 1500 words) of (draft) thesis text to submit at the start of the course (not the thesis proposal but part of a chapter of the thesis).

The course also introduces tools and practices that help with writing in English. In addition, students collaborate on writing exercises where giving and receiving peer feedback is an essential component.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: LC-4350 Ranska 5 (3 op) tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: LC-4350 Franska 5 (3 sp) eller motsvarande kunskaper
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: LC-4350 French 5 (3 cr) or equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuasi:
- osaat ilmaista itseäsi sujuvasti eri tilanteissa sekä suullisesti että kirjallisesti.
- osaat pitää esitelmiä.
- omaat valmiudet uutisten seuraamiseen ja niistä keskustelemiseen ranskaksi.
- olet laajentanut tietojasi ranskankielisistä medioista ja niiden kulttuurisista ominaisuuksista.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs har du följande kunskaper:
- Du kan uttrycka dig själv ledigt i olika situationer, både muntligt och skriftligt.
- Du kan hålla föredrag.
- Du kan följa nyheter och samtala om dem på franska.
- Du har utökat dina kunskaper om franskspråkiga medier och deras kulturella egenskaper.
learningOutcomes.en:
At course completion, you will:
- be able to express yourself fluently in both speech and writing in different situations.
- be able to give presentations
- be able to follow and discuss news in French.
- have expanded your knowledge of French-speaking medias and their cultural features.

content.fi: Suullisen ja kirjallisen ilmaisun parantaminen, esitelmän pitäminen, vaativampien rakenteiden harjoittelu, mahdollisia vierailuja ranskankielisiin tilaisuuksiin yliopiston ulkopuolelle. Aihepiirejä mm. ranskankieliset mediat, työelämä, opiskelu, kulttuuri ja maantuntemus.
content.sv: Förbättring av den muntliga och skriftliga uttrycksförmågan, föredrag, övning av mer krävande strukturer, eventuella franskspråkiga evenemang utanför universitetet. Ämnesområden som behandlas är bl.a. franskspråkig media, arbetsliv, studier, kultur och kännedom om fransktalande länder.
content.en: Improving your spoken and written expression in French, giving presentations, practising demanding grammar, possible visits to off-campus French-language events. Topics include French media, the world of work, studying, knowledge of French-speaking countries and cultures.

assesmentMethods.fi:
1. Luennot 24-36 t, aktiivinen osallistuminen opetukseen. Pakollinen läsnäolo 80 %. Osallistuminen vahvistettava ensimmäisellä luennolla. 
2. Kirjalliset tehtävät itsenäisesti ja tunneilla ja/tai testit ( 
30%) 
3. Suullinen koe ja/tai suulliset tehtävät  (70 %)
assesmentMethods.sv:
1. Föreläsningar 24 eller 36 h, aktivt deltagande i undervisningen (10 %). Obligatorisk närvaro 80 %. Du ska bekräfta att du deltar i kursen på den första föreläsningen.
2. Test på timmarna och/eller skrivuppgifter (30 %)
3. Muntligt prov (10 %)
4. Skriftlig tentamen (50 %)
assesmentMethods.en:
1. Lectures 24 h or 36 h, active participation in class (10%). 80% attendance in class is required. Registration must be confirmed by attending the first lecture.
2. Classroom tests and/or written assignments (30%)
3. Oral test (10%)
4. Written examination: 50%

workload.fi: 1. Lähiopetus: luennot 36 h 2. Itsenäinen opiskelu: oppimistehtävät ja liikekirjemoduuli sekä luennoille ja tentteihin valmistautuminen 42 h 3. Tentit (kirjallinen ja suullinen) 3 h
workload.sv: 1. Närundervisning: föreläsningar 36 h 2. Självständigt arbete: kursuppgifter, affärsbrevsmodul samt förberedelse inför föreläsningar och tentamina 42 h 3. Tentamina (Skriftlig och muntlig) 3 h
workload.en: 1. Contact hours: lectures 36 h 2. Independent study (learning assignments, a module on business letters, lectures and preparation for tests): 42 h 3. Examinations (oral and written): 3 h

prerequisites.fi: Kurssi LC-8577 Venäjä 7 tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.en: LC-8577 Russian 7 or the equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi: Kielitaidon ja esiintymistaidon kehittyminen turvallisessa ympäristössä. Kurssilla laajennetaan ja syvennetään sekä sanavarastoa että kieliopillista ymmärrystä ja niiden käyttöä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Utveckling av språkkunskaper och förmåga att uppträda, i trygg miljö. På kursen utvidgas och fördjupas både vokabulären och den grammatiska förståelsen och användningen av dem.
learningOutcomes.en: Developing language proficiency and presentation skills in a supportive environment. The course adds breadth and depth to your working vocabulary and comprehension and use of grammar.

content.fi: Kurssilla keskustellaan, luetaan ajankohtaisia artikkeleita ja laaditaan kirjoitelmia. Aiheina ovat mm. johtamistaidot, ajanhallinta ja tavoitteiden saavuttaminen sekä tehtävien priorisointi.
content.sv: På kursen diskuterar vi, läser aktuella artiklar och skriver uppsatser. Ämnen som behandlas är bl.a. ledarförmåga, tidsplanering, att uppnå mål och prioritering av uppgifter.
content.en:
Course participants have conversations, read
current articles and produce written compositions. The topics include
leadership skills, time management, goal achievement, and prioritising tasks.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssilla edellytetään säännöllistä läsnäoloa, aktiivista osallistumista oppitunneilla ja kotitehtävien tekemistä. Kurssiin kuuluu erilaisten liikekirjeiden kirjoittaminen. Yhdistetty kirjallinen ja suullinen tentti tai projektitehtävä. Osasuoritusten vaikutus kokonaisarvosanaan ilmoitetaan kurssin alkaessa.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursen kräver regelbunden närvaro, aktivt deltagande på lektionerna och utförande av hemuppgifterna. Att skriva olika typer av affärsbrev hör till kursen. Kombinerad skriftlig och muntlig tentamen. Hur delprestationer inverkar på helhetsvitsordet meddelas i början av kursen.
assesmentMethods.en: The course requires regular attendance, active participation in class and completion of homework assignments. Composition of various types of business correspondence. A combined written and oral examination. The weights given to the different assignments in the final grade are specified at the start of the course.

substitutes.en: Substitutes for the course LC-8351 Russian Business Communication A.

name.fi: Johtamisviestintä D_this group is in Finnish, Luento-opetus
name.en: Leadership Communication D_This group is in Finnish, Lecture

workload.fi: Kontaktiopetus 24 h, itsenäinen työskentely 57 h Kurssin suorittaminen edellyttää  80 % läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa.
workload.sv: Kontaktundervisning 24 h, självständigt arbete 57 h Godkänd kurs förutsätter 80 % närvaro i kontaktundervisningen.
workload.en: Contact hours 24 h, independent study 57 h Passing the course requires 80% attendance in class.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija: - ymmärtää viestinnän ja vuorovaikutuksen merkityksen johtamisessa
- tietää millaista viestintä- ja vuorovaikutusosaamista johtamisessa ja esihenkilötyössä tarvitaan
- osaa antaa, pyytää ja vastaanottaa rakentavaa palautetta
- osaa analysoida ja kehittää omaa vuorovaikutusosaamistaan
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter slutförd kurs - förstår den studerande betydelsen av kommunikation och interaktion i anslutning till ledarskap - vet den studerande hurdana kunskaper inom kommunikation och interaktion som behövs för chefsarbete - kan den studerande ge, be om och ta emot konstruktiv respons - kan den studerande analysera och utveckla sina interaktionsfärdigheter.
learningOutcomes.en:
After taking the course, students will:
- understand the significance of communication and interpersonal interaction in leadership - know the core communication competencies needed in leadership and managerial work
- be able to give, ask for and receive constructive feedback
- be able to analyze and develop their own communication competence.

content.fi: Kurssilla käsitellään johtamista viestinnän näkökulmasta. Viestinnän näkökulma johtamiseen korostaa viestinnän ja vuorovaikutuksen keskeistä roolia johtamisessa ja esihenkilötyössä. Keskeisiä teemoja ovat johtajan vuorovaikutusosaaminen; johtajan ja alaisen vuorovaikutussuhde; palautteen antaminen, pyytäminen ja vastaanottaminen; kuunteleminen ja vuorovaikutustaidot; vaikeat johtaja-alaiskeskustelut; ryhmäviestintä, kokousten ja tiimien johtaminen. Kurssilla käsitellään myös etäjohtamista ja teknologiavälitteistä johtamisviestintää. Kurssi on käytännönläheinen ja osallistava. Kurssi sisältää keskustelevaa luennointia, pienryhmätyöskentelyä, harjoituksia, viestintätilanteiden simulaatioita sekä kirjallisia oppimistehtäviä. Kurssilla käsitellään useita työelämätaitoja.
content.sv: På kursen behandlas ledarskap ur ett kommunikationsperspektiv. Kommunikationsperspektivet på ledarskap framhäver kommunikationens och interaktionens centrala roll i ledar- och chefsjobb. Centrala teman är ledarens interaktionsfärdigheter, interaktionsförhållande mellan ledare och underställd, att ge, ta emot och be om respons, lyssnande och interaktionsfärdigheter, svåra diskussioner mellan ledare och underställd, gruppkommunikation, att leda möten och team. På kursen behandlas också distansledarskap och teknologibaserad ledarskapskommunikation. Kursen är praktisk till sin natur och baserad på deltagande. Kursen innehåller diskussionsbaserade föreläsningar, arbete i små grupper, övningar, simulering av kommunikationssituationer och skriftliga uppgifter. Många arbetslivsfärdigheter behandlas på kursen.
content.en: The course goes through leadership from the viewpoint of communication. The communication approach to leadership emphasizes the centrality of interpersonal interaction in leadership and managerial work. Key themes of the course include leader’s communication competence; the interpersonal relationships between leaders and followers; giving, receiving, and seeking feedback; listening and communication skills, handling difficult conversations; group communication, running effective meetings and leading teams. The course also deals with e-leadership, remote working, and technologically mediated communication. The course takes a practical approach and encourages active participation from students. The course includes interactive lectures, group discussions, exercises and simulation activities, and written assignments. The course deals with several skills needed in the world of work.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin hyväksytty suorittaminen edellyttää 80% läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa, aktiivista ja rakentavaa osallistumista luentoihin, ryhmätöihin ja harjoituksiin sekä kurssin oppimistehtävien hyväksyttyä suorittamista. Kurssin työskentelymuotoja ovat keskusteleva luennointi, ryhmätyöskentely, harjoitukset ja kirjalliset oppimistehtävät.
assesmentMethods.sv: För att få godkänt i kursen förutsätts 80 % närvaro under kontaktundervisningen, aktivt och konstruktivt deltagande i föreläsningarna, grupparbetena och övningarna samt godkänt i kursuppgifterna. I kursen ingår diskussionsinriktade föreläsningar, grupparbete, övningar och skriftliga kursuppgifter.
assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires an 80% attendance rate in contact teaching, active and constructive participation in class, group work and exercises, as well as passing all the assignments given on the course. The course working methods include interactive lectures, group work, exercises and written learning assignments.

Centrala teman är ledarens interaktionsfärdigheter, interaktionsförhållande mellan ledare och underställd, att ge, ta emot och be om respons, lyssnande och interaktionsfärdigheter, svåra diskussioner mellan ledare och underställd, gruppkommunikation, att leda möten och team. På kursen behandlas också distansledarskap och teknologibaserad ledarskapskommunikation. Kursen är praktisk till sin natur och baserad på deltagande. Kursen innehåller diskussionsbaserade föreläsningar, arbete i små grupper, övningar, simulering av kommunikationssituationer och skriftliga uppgifter. Många arbetslivsfärdigheter behandlas på kursen.
content.en: The course goes through leadership from the viewpoint of communication. The communication approach to leadership emphasizes the centrality of interpersonal interaction in leadership and managerial work. Key themes of the course include leader’s communication competence; the interpersonal relationships between leaders and followers; giving, receiving, and seeking feedback; listening and communication skills, handling difficult conversations; group communication, running effective meetings and leading teams. The course also deals with e-leadership, remote working, and technologically mediated communication. The course takes a practical approach and encourages active participation from students. The course includes interactive lectures, group discussions, exercises and simulation activities, and written assignments. The course deals with several skills needed in the world of work.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssin hyväksytty suorittaminen edellyttää 80% läsnäoloa kontaktiopetuksessa, aktiivista ja rakentavaa osallistumista luentoihin, ryhmätöihin ja harjoituksiin sekä kurssin oppimistehtävien hyväksyttyä suorittamista. Kurssin työskentelymuotoja ovat keskusteleva luennointi, ryhmätyöskentely, harjoitukset ja kirjalliset oppimistehtävät.
assesmentMethods.sv: För att få godkänt i kursen förutsätts 80 % närvaro under kontaktundervisningen, aktivt och konstruktivt deltagande i föreläsningarna, grupparbetena och övningarna samt godkänt i kursuppgifterna. I kursen ingår diskussionsinriktade föreläsningar, grupparbete, övningar och skriftliga kursuppgifter.
assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires an 80% attendance rate in contact teaching, active and constructive participation in class, group work and exercises, as well as passing all the assignments given on the course. The course working methods include interactive lectures, group work, exercises and written learning assignments.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Opiskelija - aktivoituu mielipiteiden ilmaisuun ja argumentointiin
- käyttää erilaisia perustelukeinoja tavoitteellisesti
- ymmärtää argumentoinnin roolin vuorovaikutuksessa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Den studerande
- aktiverar uttryck av och argumentation för åsikter - använder olika motiveringssätt ändamålsenligt - förstår argumentationens roll i växelverkan
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, students will:
- be more active in expressing their opinions and arguments- use various argumentation methods in a goal-oriented manner- understand the meaning of argumentation in interaction

content.fi: Kurssin keskeisiä teemoja ovat argumentoinnin eri ulottuvuudet, viestinnän eettisyys, assertiivisuus ja palautetaidot. Kurssilla harjoitellaan argumentointitaitoja erilaisisten harjoitusmenetelmien avulla kuten esimerkiksi väittelytilanteissa.
content.sv: Centrala teman på kursen är argumenteringens olika dimensioner, etiken i kommunikationen, assertivitet och responsfärdigheter. På kursen övar vi argumenteringsfärdigheterna i exempelvis debattsituationer med hjälp av olika övningsmetoder.
content.en: Key themes of the course include: different aspects of argumentation, communication ethics, assertiveness and feedback skills. The course hones students argumentation skills using a variety of methods, such as debating exercises.

assesmentMethods.en: Passing the course requires an 80% attendance rate in contact teaching, active and constructive participation in group work and exercises, as well as passing all the assignments given on the course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuasi:
- Ymmärrät rajatun määrän tavallisimpia sanoja ja fraaseja
- Osaat keskustella hyvin yksinkertaisesti henkilökohtaisista perustiedoista
- Pystyt lukemaan yksinkertaisimpia lauseita kana-tavumerkkien avulla
- Kykenet kirjoittamaan kana-tavumerkeillä
- Sinulla on alustava käsitys japanilaisesta tapakulttuurista ja kielen eri rekistereistä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs

- förstår du en begränsad mängd av de vanligaste orden och fraserna

- kan du diskutera personliga saker på en mycket grundläggande nivå

- kan du läsa enkla meningar med hjälp av kana-tecken

- kan du skriva med kana-tecken

- har du en preliminär förståelse för japanska seder och bruk och språkets olika register.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, students will:- Understand a limited number of common words and phrases- Be able to have a conversation in a very simple way about basic personal information- Be able to read simple sentences in ‘kana’ syllabic script- Be able to write in ‘kana’ syllabic script- Have an initial understanding of Japanese customs and the different registers of the language.

name.sv: Ryska 8 Företagskommunikation på ryska B (o,w), Föreläsning
name.en: Russian 8 Russian Business Communication B (o,w), Lecture

workload.fi: 1. Lähiopetus: luennot 36 h 2. Itsenäinen opiskelu: oppimistehtävät ja liikekirjemoduuli sekä luennoille ja tentteihin valmistautuminen 42 h 3. Tentit (kirjallinen ja suullinen) 3 h
workload.sv: 1. Närundervisning: föreläsningar 36 h 2. Självständigt arbete: kursuppgifter, affärsbrevsmodul samt förberedelse inför föreläsningar och tentamina 42 h 3. Tentamina (skriftlig och muntlig) 3 h
workload.en: 1. Contact hours: lectures 36 h 2. Independent study (learning assignments, a module on business letters, preparation for lectures and tests): 42 h 3. Examinations (oral and written): 3 h

prerequisites.fi: Kurssi LC-8581 Venäjänkielinen yritysviestintä A tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: LC-8581 Företagskommunikation på ryska A eller motsvarande kunskaper
prerequisites.en: LC-8581 Russian Business Communication A or the equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kielitaidon ja esiintymistaidon kehittyminen
turvallisessa ympäristössä. Pystyt osallistumaan keskusteluihin, jotka koskevat palvelujen laatua ja toiminnan kehittämistä. Olet vahvistanut asiakielessä käytettävien rakenteiden hallintaa ja kirjallisen viestinnän taitojasi. Pystyt toimimaan kansainvälisessä liikealan toimintaympäristössä asianmukaisesti ja kulttuurieroja huomioiden.
learningOutcomes.sv: Utveckling av språkkunskaper och förmåga att uppträda, i trygg miljö. Du kan delta i diskussioner som berör kvaliteten på produkter och utveckling av affärsverksamhet. Du har stärkt din behärskning av fackspråkliga strukturer och dina färdigheter i skriftlig affärskommunikation. Du kan agera i internationella verksamhetsmiljön inom affärsbranschen på ett lämpligt sätt och med hänsyn till kulturella skillnader.
learningOutcomes.en: On completing the course, you will: be able to function in various kinds of business situations and present products and services be able to take part in discussions concerning service quality and business development. The course will reinforce the students command of the structural elements used in factual texts as well as their skills in business prose. They will be able to operate in a international business environment in a culturally savvy and appropriate manner.

content.fi: Kurssilla keskustellaan, luetaan ajankohtaisia artikkeleita ja laaditaan kirjoitelmia. Aiheina ovat laatu, asiakaspalvelu, henkilökunnan valinta, muutostilanteiden haasteet jne.
content.sv: På kursen diskuterar vi, läser aktuella artiklar och skriver uppsatser. Ämnen som behandlas är bl.a. kundservice, val av personal, utmaningar i samband med förändringar osv.
content.en: Course participants have conversations, read current articles and produce written compositions. The topics include quality management, customer service, staff recruitment and change management challenges.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssilla edellytetään säännöllistä läsnäoloa, aktiivista osallistumista oppitunneilla ja kotitehtävien tekemistä. Kirjallisten tehtävien suorittaminen. Yhdistetty kirjallinen ja suullinen tentti tai projektitehtävä. Osasuoritusten vaikutus kokonaisarvosanaan ilmoitetaan kurssin alkaessa.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursen kräver regelbunden närvaro, aktivt deltagande på lektionerna och utförande av hemuppgifterna. Att skriva olika typer av affärsbrev hör till kursen. Kombinerad skriftlig och muntlig tentamen. Hur delprestationer inverkar på helhetsvitsordet meddelas i början av kursen.
assesmentMethods.en: The course requires regular attendance, active participation in class and completion of homework assignments. Composition of various types of business correspondence. A combined written and oral examination. The weights given to the different assignments in the final grade are specified at the start of the course.

substitutes.fi: Korvaa kurssin LC-8352 Venäjänkielinen yritysviestintä B.
substitutes.sv: Ersätter kursen LC-8352 Företagskommunikation på ryska B.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completion of this course, the students will 

·       be aware of today’s working life requirements

·       be inspired to adopt self-leadership tools 

·       understand situational requirements in communications regarding formality, compassion and assertiveness

·       feel more comfortable presenting in public and defending one’s views in dialogue

·       master collaboration strategies relevant to teamwork
learningOutcomes.sv:

·       master collaboration strategies relevant to teamwork
learningOutcomes.en:
Upon completion of this course, the students will 

·       be aware of today’s working life requirements

·       be inspired to adopt self-leadership tools 

·       understand situational requirements in communications regarding formality, compassion and assertiveness

·       feel more comfortable presenting in public and defending one’s views in dialogue

·       master collaboration strategies relevant to teamwork

content.fi: This course raises awareness of competence requirements in working life. This is achieved by reviewing trends urging university graduates to hone their metaskills. We focus particularly on self-leadership and recognize students’ character strengths but also set goals for students’ professional growth. As pedagogy, simulations and reactive exercises allow students to develop responsiveness in dialogue. The course places emphasis on such dialogical skills as assertiveness, listening and empathy. Interaction skills are practiced in oral and written contexts: in oral contexts students rehearse skills relevant to human exchange, and in written contexts they learn formality strategies, clarity, concision and coherence. As a key written assignment, students write an executive summary related to their project work. Finally, students develop teamwork abilities by managing a project and exchanging feedback on individual performance.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan ryhmä- ja tiimiviestinnän peruskäsitteisiin, teorioihin ja ilmiöihin sekä harjoitellaan ryhmä- ja tiimitilanteissa tarvittavia vuorovaikutustaitoja. Keskeisimpiä teemoja ovat ryhmän vuorovaikutuksen ja toiminnan suunnittelu, ryhmäprosessit ja -roolit, viestintäkulttuurit, konfliktit ja ongelmanratkaisu ryhmässä. Teemoja tarkastellaan erityisesti projektityöskentelyn kontekstissa.

content.fi: Kurssilla käsitellään neuvottelutaitoa vuorovaikutuksen näkökulmasta. Keskeisiä teemoja ovat neuvotteluun valmistautuminen, tavoitteiden asettaminen, yhteistyöhakuisuus, neuvottelijan vuorovaikutustaidot ja ongelmanratkaisu. Kurssi on käytännönläheinen ja harjoituspainotteinen. Kurssilla harjoitellaan työelämätaitoja kuten neuvottelutaitoja, yhteistyötaitoja, vuorovaikutustaitoja, ryhmäviestintää, perustelutaitoja, ongelmanratkaisua ja konfliktinhallintaa ryhmässä.
